Title: Economic analysis for solvent recovery system (solvent as cleaning liquid for the processing equipment)
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nasution, J., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mahardini, K.A., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to aggravate more reuse and recover material in chemical or in any industry that use mixing process or cleaning equipment that use solvent. This study also gave new approach on sustainable solution that assess by economic advantage. In many industry solvents is used for cleaning the processing equipment's to avoid cross contamination from one batch to the other, due to the solvent scrap is being generated in the cleaning process. In often times, this scrap has been thrown away since it is already contaminated with the products, so it is being considered as scrap. In order to minimize the scrap, recovery of solvent is one method to recover the solvent. For the research, the distillation process was proposed, so the contaminated solvent can be purified so it can be use again for cleaning, or in some case it can be also use again as raw material for products. The solvent recovery is not only minimizing carbon foot print but also provides more sustainability. The solvent recovery gives also cost advantage for the industry. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: distillation; recovery system; solvent for cleaning; Waste solvent; waste treatment
Index Keywords: Chemical cleaning; Chemical equipment; Contamination; Distillation; Economic analysis; Recovery; Waste treatment; Cleaning equipments; Cross contamination; Distillation process; Processing equipment; Recovery systems; Solvent recovery systems; Sustainable solution; Waste solvents; Solvents

Authors: Ompusungg A.P., Damaristella, Viosita L., Mahardini K.A.
Title: The effect of preventive maintenance scheduling on reliability machine in PT Indonesia toray synthetics (ITS)
Affiliations: Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ompusungg, A.P., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Damaristella, Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Viosita, L., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mahardini, K.A., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The objection of this research is to analyze the influence factors of reliability machine and preventive maintenance scheduling on production process of staple fiber PT ITS. As for the method is used for this research is using six sigma approach with DMAIC (Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, and Control) phases to analyze types of waste of staple fiber production and factors that causes the waste. Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) Method to analyze the effect of machine productivity and performance on waste of staple fiber production using calculation of Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) and six big losses are using to analyze the losses that caused value of OEE. Failure Mode Effect Analysis (FMEA) is used to analyze the risks that probably occurs during spinning process on production line 28P which causes the high total time losses on idling and minor stoppages. One of the risk that has the highest probability is the amount of output caused by abnormality of gear pump machine. Based on the calculation of Time to Failure (TTF) and Time to Repair (TTR), the interval of gear pump machine replacement using age replacement model is 1300 hours and the interval of gear pump machine maintenance is 823,9277 hours as of the reliability of machine has increase after. © 2020 Innovare Academics Sciences Pvt. Ltd. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: DMAIC; Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE); Preventive Maintenance; Production Waste; Six Big Losses; Six Sigma; Staple Fiber; Total Productive Maintenance (TPM)

Title: Spatial characteristic of urban campus in Indonesia
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widaningrum, D.L., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mahardini, K., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Location becomes one of the principal factors in developing higher education facilities. There is a primary difference between the location characteristic of the university campus and urban campus. The university campus usually locates in the suburbs with public facilities integrated into the campus. Meanwhile, urban campus is in the city or urban area where the public life of the academic community will dispense in public facilities scattered around the campus. Understanding the spatial characteristics of existing urban campuses are expected to provide insight about essential points to consider in determining the appropriate location. This study aims to explore the spatial characteristics of an urban campus in Indonesia with other public facilities. The result of this study is information about the neighborhood relationship between urban campus with other public facilities. The Geographic Information System Approach is implemented to store, manage, and visualize spatial data collected, using QGIS Desktop software. PostgreSQL and PostGIS are used for spatial data analysis to get neighborhoods characteristic around the campus. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: GIS; POI; Spatial analysis; urban campus
Index Keywords: Facilities; Geographic information systems; Information management; Location; Academic community; Principal factors; Public facilities; Spatial analysis; Spatial characteristics; Spatial data analysis; University campus; urban campus; Spatial variables measurement

Authors: Sahroni T.R., Sukarman A.F., Mahardini K.A.
Title: Design and analysis of sustainable computer mouse using design for disassembly methodology
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Industrial Engineering Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Manufacturing Engineering, Universiti Teknikal Malaysia Melaka (UTeM), Hang Tuah Jaya, Durian Tunggal, Melaka, 76100, Malaysia; Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sahroni, T.R., Industrial Engineering Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sukarman, A.F., Faculty of Manufacturing Engineering, Universiti Teknikal Malaysia Melaka (UTeM), Hang Tuah Jaya, Durian Tunggal, Melaka, 76100, Malaysia; Mahardini, K.A., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper presents the design and analysis of computer mouse using Design for Disassembly methodology. Basically, the existing computer mouse model consist a number of unnecessary part that cause the assembly and disassembly time in production. The objective of this project is to design a new computer mouse based on Design for Disassembly (DFD) methodology. The main methodology of this paper was proposed from sketch generation, concept selection, and concept scoring. Based on the design screening, design concept B was selected for further analysis. New design of computer mouse is proposed using fastening system. Furthermore, three materials of ABS, Polycarbonate, and PE high density were prepared to determine the environmental impact category. Sustainable analysis was conducted using software SolidWorks. As a result, PE High Density gives the lowers amount in the environmental category with great maximum stress value. © 2017 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: computer mouse; Design analysis; disassembly; manufacturing; sustainable
Index Keywords: Ecodesign; Environmental impact; Manufacture; Sustainable development; Computer mouse; Concept selection; Design Analysis; Design and analysis; disassembly; Disassembly time; Maximum stress; sustainable; Design

Authors: Kim B.S., Mahardini K.A., Seo W., Koh S.
Title: Minimizing makespan for non-identical parallel machine with sequence dependent setup times
Affiliations: Department of Industrial and Management Engineering, Incheon National University, 119 Academy-ro, Yeonsu-gu, Incheon, South Korea; Department of Industrial Engineering, De La Salle Catholic University, Kairagi I Kombos, Manado, Indonesia; Department of Systems Management and Engineering, Pukyong National University, Yongsoro 45, Namgu, Busan, 608-737, South Korea
Authors with affiliations: Kim, B.S., Department of Industrial and Management Engineering, Incheon National University, 119 Academy-ro, Yeonsu-gu, Incheon, South Korea; Mahardini, K.A., Department of Industrial Engineering, De La Salle Catholic University, Kairagi I Kombos, Manado, Indonesia; Seo, W., Department of Systems Management and Engineering, Pukyong National University, Yongsoro 45, Namgu, Busan, 608-737, South Korea; Koh, S., Department of Systems Management and Engineering, Pukyong National University, Yongsoro 45, Namgu, Busan, 608-737, South Korea
Abstract: This research deals with a problem that minimizes makespan in a non-identical parallel machine system with sequence dependent setup times. We first present a new mixed integer programming formulation for the problem, after that, since the problem is NP-hard, we propose four heuristic solution procedures including genetic based algorithms to solve the practical big-size problems in a reasonable computational time. To assess the performance of the algorithms, we conduct a computational experiment and compare the performances of the heuristics. © 2015, ICIC International.
Author Keywords: Heuristic; Non-identical parallel machines; Sequence dependent setup time
Index Keywords: Business machines; Heuristic algorithms; Integer programming; Scheduling algorithms; Computational experiment; Genetic-based algorithms; Heuristic; Heuristic solutions; Minimizing makespan; Mixed integer programming; Non-identical parallel machine; Sequence-dependent setup time; Optimization
